ref: 10433 yavaná m. ʻ Greek, foreigner ʼ Pāṇ., yauna -- m. ʻ name of a people ʼ MBh. [Prob. sanskritization of yōna -- ← OPers. yauna -- ← Gk. )*ia/ones, though separate borrowing as yavana -- cannot be excluded EWA iii 9 with lit.]

lang: Aśokan, i.e. the language of the Inscriptions of Aśoka

ref: Si. yon ʻ Arabia ʼ, yonā ʻ Arab trader in Ceylon ʼ.
